title: What notable musicians never performed live? - Quora

response.answer_text: Mike Oldfield produced his monster hit album Tubular Balls while living as a hermit at Richard Branson’s studio the Manor in his late teenage years. Oldfield had never performed in front of an audience and was extremely reluctant to do so. Eventually a string of renowned musicians was put together to record a live performance for the BBC. Driving to the studio in Branson’s Bentley Oldfield has a panic attack and in order to induce him to carry on with the performance Branson promised he would give him the Bentley.

I’m not 100% sure, but I believe Nilsson never did. The closest he came was being part of the Lumberjacks’ Chorus on one of Monty Python’s NYC performances. I may have seen him - there was a guest singer the time I saw them, and he looked like Nilsson, but I’m not sure if that’s who it was. EDIT: Actually, he did a few live performances, mostly in Europe. But he didn’t like playing live, and only did so because his manager urged him to.
